3.verse: He will say, “Listen, Israel! Today you are going into battle against your enemies. Don’t lose your courage or be afraid. Don’t panic or be frightened,

4.verse: because the LORD your God goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies and to save you.”

5.verse: The officers should say to the army, “Has anyone built a new house but not given it to God? He may go home, because he might die in battle and someone else would get to give his house to God.

6.verse: Has anyone planted a vineyard and not begun to enjoy it? He may go home, because he might die in battle and someone else would enjoy his vineyard.

7.verse: Is any man engaged to a woman and not yet married to her? He may go home, because he might die in battle and someone else would marry her.”

8.verse: Then the officers should also say, “Is anyone here afraid? Has anyone lost his courage? He may go home so that he will not cause others to lose their courage, too.”

9.verse: When the officers finish speaking to the army, they should appoint commanders to lead it.

10.verse: When you march up to attack a city, first make them an offer of peace.

11.verse: If they accept your offer and open their gates to you, all the people of that city will become your slaves and work for you.

12.verse: But if they do not make peace with you and fight you in battle, you should surround that city.

13.verse: The LORD your God will give it to you. Then kill all the men with your swords,

14.verse: and you may take everything else in the city for yourselves. Take the women, children, and animals, and you may use these things the LORD your God gives you from your enemies.

15.verse: Do this to all the cities that are far away, that do not belong to the nations nearby.

16.verse: But leave nothing alive in the cities of the land the LORD your God is giving you.

17.verse: Completely destroy these people: the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, as the LORD your God has commanded.

18.verse: Otherwise, they will teach you what they do for their gods, and if you do these hateful things, you will sin against the LORD your God.

19.verse: If you surround and attack a city for a long time, trying to capture it, do not destroy its trees with an ax. You can eat the fruit from the trees, but do not cut them down. These trees are not the enemy, so don’t make war against them.

20.verse: But you may cut down trees that you know are not fruit trees and use them to build devices to attack the city walls, until the city is captured.

1.verse: A Person Found Murdered - Suppose someone is found murdered, lying in a field in the land the LORD your God is giving you as your own, and no one knows who killed the person.

2.verse: Your elders and judges should go to where the body was found, and they should measure how far it is to the nearby cities.

3.verse: The elders of the city nearest the body must take a young cow that has never worked or worn a yoke,

4.verse: and they must lead her down to a valley that has never been plowed or planted, with a stream flowing through it. There they must break the young cow’s neck.

5.verse: The priests, the sons of Levi, should come forward, because they have been chosen by the LORD your God to serve him and to give blessings in the LORD’s name. They are the ones who decide cases of quarreling and attacks.

6.verse: Then all the elders of the city nearest the murdered person should wash their hands over the young cow whose neck was broken in the valley.

7.verse: They should declare: “We did not kill this person, and we did not see it happen.

8.verse: LORD, remove this sin from your people Israel, whom you have saved. Don’t blame your people, the Israelites, for the murder of this innocent person.” And so the murder will be paid for.

9.verse: Then you will have removed from yourselves the guilt of murdering an innocent person, because you will be doing what the LORD says is right.

10.verse: Captive Women as Wives - When you go to war against your enemies, the LORD will help you defeat them so that you will take them captive.

11.verse: If you see a beautiful woman among the captives and are attracted to her, you may take her as your wife.

12.verse: Bring her into your home, where she must shave her head and cut her nails

13.verse: and change the clothes she was wearing when you captured her. After she has lived in your house and cried for her parents for a month, you may marry her. You will be her husband, and she will be your wife.

14.verse: But if you are not pleased with her, you must let her go anywhere she wants. You must not sell her for money or make her a slave, because you have taken away her honor.

15.verse: The Oldest Son - A man might have two wives, one he loves and one he doesn’t. Both wives might have sons by him. If the older son belongs to the wife he does not love,

16.verse: when that man wills his property to his sons he must not give the son of the wife he loves what belongs to the older son, the son of the wife he does not love.

17.verse: He must agree to give the older son two shares of everything he owns, even though the older son is from the wife he does not love. That son was the first to prove his father could have children, so he has the rights that belong to the older son.

18.verse: Sons Who Refuse to Obey - If someone has a son who is stubborn, who turns against his father and mother and doesn’t obey them or listen when they correct him,

19.verse: his parents must take him to the elders at the city gate.

20.verse: They will say to the elders, “Our son is stubborn and turns against us. He will not obey us. He eats too much, and he is always drunk.”

21.verse: Then all the men in his town must throw stones at him until he dies. Get rid of the evil among you, because then all the people of Israel will hear about this and be afraid.

22.verse: Other Laws - If someone is guilty of a sin worthy of death, he must be put to death and his body displayed on a tree.

23.verse: But don’t leave his body hanging on the tree overnight; be sure to bury him that same day, because anyone whose body is displayed on a tree is cursed by God. You must not ruin the land the LORD your God is giving you as your own.

1.verse: If you see your fellow Israelite’s ox or sheep wandering away, don’t ignore it. Take it back to its owner.

2.verse: If the owner does not live close to you, or if you do not know who the owner is, take the animal home with you. Keep it until the owner comes looking for it; then give it back.

3.verse: Do the same thing if you find a donkey or coat or anything someone lost. Don’t just ignore it.

4.verse: If you see your fellow Israelite’s donkey or ox fallen on the road, don’t ignore it. Help the owner get it up.

5.verse: A woman must not wear men’s clothes, and a man must not wear women’s clothes. The LORD your God hates anyone who does that.

6.verse: If you find a bird’s nest by the road, either in a tree or on the ground, and the mother bird is sitting on the young birds or eggs, do not take the mother bird with the young birds.

7.verse: You may take the young birds, but you must let the mother bird go free. Then things will go well for you, and you will live a long time.

8.verse: When you build a new house, build a low wall around the edge of the roof so you will not be guilty if someone falls off the roof.

9.verse: Don’t plant two different kinds of seeds in your vineyard. Otherwise, both crops will be ruined.

10.verse: Don’t plow with an ox and a donkey tied together.

11.verse: Don’t wear clothes made of wool and linen woven together.

12.verse: Tie several pieces of thread together; then put these tassels on the four corners of your coat.

13.verse: Marriage Laws - If a man marries a girl and has sexual relations with her but then decides he does not like her,

14.verse: he might talk badly about her and give her a bad name. He might say, “I married this woman, but when I had sexual relations with her, I did not find that she was a virgin.”

15.verse: Then the girl’s parents must bring proof that she was a virgin to the elders at the city gate.

16.verse: The girl’s father will say to the elders, “I gave my daughter to this man to be his wife, but now he does not want her.

17.verse: This man has told lies about my daughter. He has said, ‘I did not find your daughter to be a virgin,’ but here is the proof that my daughter was a virgin.” Then her parents are to show the sheet to the elders of the city,

18.verse: and the elders must take the man and punish him.

19.verse: They must make him pay about two and one-half pounds of silver to the girl’s father, because the man has given an Israelite virgin a bad name. The girl will continue to be the man’s wife, and he may not divorce her as long as he lives.

20.verse: But if the things the husband said about his wife are true, and there is no proof that she was a virgin,

21.verse: the girl must be brought to the door of her father’s house. Then the men of the town must put her to death by throwing stones at her. She has done a disgraceful thing in Israel by having sexual relations before she was married. You must get rid of the evil among you.

22.verse: If a man is found having sexual relations with another man’s wife, both the woman and the man who had sexual relations with her must die. Get rid of this evil from Israel.

23.verse: If a man meets a virgin in a city and has sexual relations with her, but she is engaged to another man,

24.verse: you must take both of them to the city gate and put them to death by throwing stones at them. Kill the girl, because she was in a city and did not scream for help. And kill the man for having sexual relations with another man’s wife. You must get rid of the evil among you.

25.verse: But if a man meets an engaged girl out in the country and forces her to have sexual relations with him, only the man who had sexual relations with her must be put to death.

26.verse: Don’t do anything to the girl, because she has not done a sin worthy of death. This is like the person who attacks and murders a neighbor;

27.verse: the man found the engaged girl in the country and she screamed, but no one was there to save her.

28.verse: If a man meets a virgin who is not engaged to be married and forces her to have sexual relations with him and people find out about it,

29.verse: the man must pay the girl’s father about one and one-fourth pounds of silver. He must also marry the girl, because he has dishonored her, and he may never divorce her for as long as he lives.

30.verse: A man must not marry his father’s wife; he must not dishonor his father in this way.

1.verse: The Lord’s People - No man who has had part of his sex organ cut off may come into the meeting to worship the LORD.

2.verse: No one born to parents who were forbidden by law to marry may come into the meeting to worship the LORD. The descendants for ten generations may not come in either.

3.verse: No Ammonite or Moabite may come into the meeting to worship the LORD, and none of their descendants for ten generations may come in.

4.verse: This is because the Ammonites and Moabites did not give you bread and water when you came out of Egypt. And they hired Balaam son of Beor, from Pethor in Northwest Mesopotamia, to put a curse on you.

5.verse: But the LORD your God would not listen to Balaam. He turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.

6.verse: Don’t wish for their peace or success as long as you live.

7.verse: Don’t hate Edomites; they are your close relatives. Don’t hate Egyptians, because you were foreigners in their country.

8.verse: The great-grandchildren of these two peoples may come into the meeting to worship the LORD.

9.verse: Keeping the Camp Clean - When you are camped in time of war, keep away from unclean things.

10.verse: If a man becomes unclean during the night, he must go outside the camp and not come back.

11.verse: But when evening comes, he must wash himself, and at sunset he may come back into the camp.

12.verse: Choose a place outside the camp where people may go to relieve themselves.

13.verse: Carry a tent peg with you, and when you relieve yourself, dig a hole and cover up your dung.

14.verse: The LORD your God moves around through your camp to protect you and to defeat your enemies for you, so the camp must be holy. He must not see anything unclean among you so that he will not leave you.

15.verse: Other Laws - If an escaped slave comes to you, do not hand over the slave to his master.

16.verse: Let the slave live with you anywhere he likes, in any town he chooses. Do not mistreat him.

17.verse: No Israelite man or woman must ever become a temple prostitute.

18.verse: Do not bring a male or female prostitute’s pay to the Temple of the LORD your God to pay what you have promised to the LORD, because the LORD your God hates prostitution.

19.verse: If you loan your fellow Israelites money or food or anything else, don’t make them pay back more than you loaned them.

20.verse: You may charge foreigners, but not fellow Israelites. Then the LORD your God will bless everything you do in the land you are entering to take as your own.

21.verse: If you make a promise to give something to the LORD your God, do not be slow to pay it, because the LORD your God demands it from you. Do not be guilty of sin.

22.verse: But if you do not make the promise, you will not be guilty.

23.verse: You must do whatever you say you will do, because you chose to make the promise to the LORD your God.

24.verse: If you go into your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you wish, but do not put any grapes into your basket.

25.verse: If you go into your neighbor’s grainfield, you may pick grain with your hands, but you must not cut down your neighbor’s grain with your sickle.

1.verse: A man might marry a woman but later decide she doesn’t please him because he has found something bad about her. He writes out divorce papers for her, gives them to her, and sends her away from his house.

2.verse: After she leaves his house, she goes and marries another man,

3.verse: but her second husband does not like her either. So he writes out divorce papers for her, gives them to her, and sends her away from his house. Or the second husband might die.

4.verse: In either case, her first husband who divorced her must not marry her again, because she has become unclean. The LORD would hate this. Don’t bring this sin into the land the LORD your God is giving you as your own.

5.verse: A man who has just married must not be sent to war or be given any other duty. He should be free to stay home for a year to make his new wife happy.

6.verse: If someone owes you something, do not take his two stones for grinding grain—not even the upper one—in place of what he owes, because this is how the person makes a living.

7.verse: If someone kidnaps a fellow Israelite, either to make him a slave or sell him, the kidnapper must be killed. You must get rid of the evil among you.

8.verse: Be careful when someone has a skin disease. Do exactly what the priests, the Levites, teach you, being careful to do what I have commanded them.

9.verse: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on your way out of Egypt.

10.verse: When you make a loan to your neighbors, don’t go into their homes to get something in place of it.

11.verse: Stay outside and let them go in and get what they promised you.

12.verse: If a poor person gives you a coat to show he will pay the loan back, don’t keep it overnight.

13.verse: Give the coat back at sunset, because your neighbor needs that coat to sleep in, and he will be grateful to you. And the LORD your God will see that you have done a good thing.

14.verse: Don’t cheat hired servants who are poor and needy, whether they are fellow Israelites or foreigners living in one of your towns.

15.verse: Pay them each day before sunset, because they are poor and need the money. Otherwise, they may complain to the LORD about you, and you will be guilty of sin.

16.verse: Parents must not be put to death if their children do wrong, and children must not be put to death if their parents do wrong. Each person must die for his own sin.

17.verse: Do not be unfair to a foreigner or an orphan. Don’t take a widow’s coat to make sure she pays you back.

18.verse: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and the LORD your God saved you from there. That is why I am commanding you to do this.

19.verse: When you are gathering your harvest in the field and leave behind a bundle of grain, don’t go back and get it. Leave it there for foreigners, orphans, and widows so that the LORD your God can bless everything you do.

20.verse: When you beat your olive trees to knock the olives off, don’t beat the trees a second time. Leave what is left for foreigners, orphans, and widows.

21.verse: When you harvest the grapes in your vineyard, don’t pick the vines a second time. Leave what is left for foreigners, orphans, and widows.

22.verse: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt; that is why I am commanding you to do this.

1.verse: If two people have an argument and go to court, the judges will decide the case. They will declare one person right and the other guilty.

2.verse: If the guilty person has to be punished with a beating, the judge will make that person lie down and be beaten in front of him. The number of lashes should match the crime.

3.verse: But don’t hit a person more than forty times, because more than that would disgrace him before others.

4.verse: When an ox is working in the grain, do not cover its mouth to keep it from eating.

5.verse: If two brothers are living together, and one of them dies without having a son, his widow must not marry someone outside her husband’s family. Her husband’s brother must marry her, which is his duty to her as a brother-in-law.

6.verse: The first son she has counts as the son of the dead brother so that his name will not be forgotten in Israel.

7.verse: But if a man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, she should go to the elders at the town gate. She should say, “My brother-in-law will not carry on his brother’s name in Israel. He refuses to do his duty for me.”

8.verse: Then the elders of the town must call for the man and talk to him. But if he is stubborn and says, “I don’t want to marry her,”

9.verse: the woman must go up to him in front of the leaders. She must take off one of his sandals and spit in his face and say, “This is for the man who won’t continue his brother’s family!”

10.verse: Then that man’s family shall be known in Israel as the Family of the Unsandaled.

11.verse: If two men are fighting and one man’s wife comes to save her husband from his attacker, grabbing the attacker by his sex organs,

12.verse: you must cut off her hand. Show her no mercy.

13.verse: Don’t carry two sets of weights with you, one heavy and one light.

14.verse: Don’t have two different sets of measures in your house, one large and one small.

15.verse: You must have true and honest weights and measures so that you will live a long time in the land the LORD your God is giving you.

16.verse: The LORD your God hates anyone who is dishonest and uses dishonest measures.

17.verse: Remember what the Amalekites did to you when you came out of Egypt.

18.verse: When you were tired and worn out, they met you on the road and attacked all those lagging behind. They were not afraid of God.

19.verse: When the LORD your God gives you rest from all the enemies around you in the land he is giving you as your own, you shall destroy any memory of the Amalekites on the earth. Do not forget!

1.verse: The First Harvest - When you go into the land the LORD your God is giving you as your own, to take it over and live in it,

2.verse: you must take some of the first harvest of crops that grow from the land the LORD your God is giving you. Put the food in a basket and go to the place where the LORD your God will choose to be worshiped.

3.verse: Say to the priest on duty at that time, “Today I declare before the LORD your God that I have come into the land the LORD promised our ancestors that he would give us.”

4.verse: The priest will take your basket and set it down in front of the altar of the LORD your God.

5.verse: Then you shall announce before the LORD your God: “My father was a wandering Aramean. He went down to Egypt with only a few people, but they became a great, powerful, and large nation there.

6.verse: But the Egyptians were cruel to us, making us suffer and work very hard.

7.verse: So we prayed to the LORD, the God of our ancestors, and he heard us. When he saw our trouble, hard work, and suffering,

8.verse: the LORD brought us out of Egypt with his great power and strength, using great terrors, signs, and miracles.

9.verse: Then he brought us to this place and gave us this fertile land.

10.verse: Now I bring part of the first harvest from this land that you, LORD, have given me.” Place the basket before the LORD your God and bow down before him.

11.verse: Then you and the Levites and foreigners among you should rejoice, because the LORD your God has given good things to you and your family.

12.verse: Bring a tenth of all your harvest the third year (the year to give a tenth of your harvest). Give it to the Levites, foreigners, orphans, and widows so that they may eat in your towns and be full.

13.verse: Then say to the LORD your God, “I have taken out of my house the part of my harvest that belongs to God, and I have given it to the Levites, foreigners, orphans, and widows. I have done everything you commanded me; I have not broken your commands, and I have not forgotten any of them.

14.verse: I have not eaten any of the holy part while I was in sorrow. I have not removed any of it while I was unclean, and I have not offered it for dead people. I have obeyed you, the LORD my God, and have done everything you commanded me.

15.verse: So look down from heaven, your holy home. Bless your people Israel and bless the land you have given us, which you promised to our ancestors—a fertile land.”

16.verse: Obey the Lord’s Commands - Today the LORD your God commands you to obey all these rules and laws; be careful to obey them with your whole being.

17.verse: Today you have said that the LORD is your God, and you have promised to do what he wants you to do—to keep his rules, commands, and laws. You have said you will obey him.

18.verse: And today the LORD has said that you are his very own people, as he has promised you. But you must obey his commands.

19.verse: He will make you greater than all the other nations he made. He will give you praise, fame, and honor, and you will be a holy people to the LORD your God, as he has said.

1.verse: The Law Written on Stones - Then Moses, along with the elders of Israel, commanded the people, saying, “Keep all the commands I have given you today.

2.verse: Soon you will cross the Jordan River to go into the land the LORD your God is giving you. On that day set up some large stones and cover them with plaster.

3.verse: When you cross over, write all the words of these teachings on them. Then you may enter the land the LORD your God is giving you, a fertile land, just as the LORD, the God of your ancestors, promised.

4.verse: After you have crossed the Jordan River, set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I command you today, and cover them with plaster.

5.verse: Build an altar of stones there to the LORD your God, but don’t use any iron tool to cut the stones;

6.verse: build the altar of the LORD your God with stones from the field. Offer burnt offerings on it to the LORD your God,

7.verse: and offer fellowship offerings there, and eat them and rejoice before the LORD your God.

8.verse: Then write clearly all the words of these teachings on the stones.”

9.verse: Curses of the Law - Then Moses and the Levites who were priests spoke to all Israel and said, “Be quiet, Israel. Listen! Today you have become the people of the LORD your God.

10.verse: Obey the LORD your God, and keep his commands and laws that I give you today.”

11.verse: That day Moses also gave the people this command:

12.verse: When you cross the Jordan River, these tribes must stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph and Benjamin.

13.verse: And these tribes must stand on Mount Ebal to announce the curses: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

14.verse: The Levites will say to all the people of Israel in a loud voice:

15.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who makes an idol or statue and secretly sets it up, because the LORD hates the idols people make.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

16.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who dishonors his father or mother.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

17.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who moves the stone that marks a neighbor’s border.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

18.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who sends a blind person down the wrong road.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

19.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who is unfair to foreigners, orphans, or widows.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

20.verse: “A man will be cursed who has sexual relations with his father’s wife, because it is a dishonor to his father.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

21.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who has sexual relations with an animal.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

22.verse: “A man will be cursed who has sexual relations with his sister, whether she is his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

23.verse: “A man will be cursed who has sexual relations with his mother-in-law.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

24.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who kills a neighbor secretly.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

25.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who takes money to murder an innocent person.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

26.verse: “Anyone will be cursed who does not agree with the words of these teachings and does not obey them.” Then all the people will say, “Amen!”

1.verse: Blessings for Obeying - You must completely obey the LORD your God, and you must carefully follow all his commands I am giving you today. Then the LORD your God will make you greater than any other nation on earth.

2.verse: Obey the LORD your God so that all these blessings will come and stay with you:

3.verse: You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the country.

4.verse: Your children will be blessed, as well as your crops; your herds will be blessed with calves and your flocks with lambs.

5.verse: Your basket and your kitchen will be blessed.

6.verse: You will be blessed when you come in and when you go out.

7.verse: The LORD will help you defeat the enemies that come to fight you. They will attack you from one direction, but they will run from you in seven directions.

8.verse: The LORD your God will bless you with full barns, and he will bless everything you do. He will bless the land he is giving you.

9.verse: The LORD will make you his holy people, as he promised. But you must obey his commands and do what he wants you to do.

10.verse: Then everyone on earth will see that you are the LORD’s people, and they will be afraid of you.

11.verse: The LORD will make you rich: You will have many children, your animals will have many young, and your land will give good crops. It is the land that the LORD promised your ancestors he would give to you.

12.verse: The LORD will open up his heavenly storehouse so that the skies send rain on your land at the right time, and he will bless everything you do. You will lend to other nations, but you will not need to borrow from them.

13.verse: The LORD will make you like the head and not like the tail; you will be on top and not on bottom. But you must obey the commands of the LORD your God that I am giving you today, being careful to keep them.

14.verse: Do not disobey anything I command you today. Do exactly as I command, and do not follow other gods or serve them.

15.verse: Curses for Disobeying - But if you do not obey the LORD your God and carefully follow all his commands and laws I am giving you today, all these curses will come upon you and stay:

16.verse: You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the country.

17.verse: Your basket and your kitchen will be cursed.

18.verse: Your children will be cursed, as well as your crops; the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks will be cursed.

19.verse: You will be cursed when you go in and when you go out.

20.verse: The LORD will send you curses, confusion, and punishment in everything you do. You will be destroyed and suddenly ruined because you did wrong when you left him.

21.verse: The LORD will give you terrible diseases and destroy you from the land you are going to take.

22.verse: The LORD will punish you with disease, fever, swelling, heat, lack of rain, plant diseases, and mildew until you die.

23.verse: The sky above will be like bronze, and the ground below will be like iron.

24.verse: The LORD will turn the rain into dust and sand, which will fall from the skies until you are destroyed.

25.verse: The LORD will help your enemies defeat you. You will attack them from one direction, but you will run from them in seven directions. And you will become a thing of horror among all the kingdoms on earth.

26.verse: Your dead bodies will be food for all the birds and wild animals, and there will be no one to scare them away.

27.verse: The LORD will punish you with boils like those the Egyptians had. You will have bad growths, sores, and itches that can’t be cured.

28.verse: The LORD will give you madness, blindness, and a confused mind.

29.verse: You will have to feel around in the daylight like a blind person. You will fail in everything you do. People will hurt you and steal from you every day, and no one will save you.

30.verse: You will be engaged to a woman, but another man will force her to have sexual relations with him. You will build a house, but you will not live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you will not get its grapes.

31.verse: Your ox will be killed before your eyes, but you will not eat any of it. Your donkey will be taken away from you, and it will not be brought back. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and no one will save you.

32.verse: Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, and you will grow tired looking for them every day, but there will be nothing you can do.

33.verse: People you don’t know will eat the crops your land and hard work have produced. You will be mistreated and abused all your life.

34.verse: The things you see will cause you to go mad.

35.verse: The LORD will give you sore boils on your knees and legs that cannot be cured, and they will go from the soles of your feet to the tops of your heads.

36.verse: The LORD will send you and your king away to a nation neither you nor your ancestors know, where you will serve other gods made of wood and stone.

37.verse: You will become a hated thing to the nations where the LORD sends you; they will laugh at you and make fun of you.

38.verse: You will plant much seed in your field, but your harvest will be small, because locusts will eat the crop.

39.verse: You will plant vineyards and work hard in them, but you will not pick the grapes or drink the wine, because the worms will eat them.

40.verse: You will have olive trees in all your land, but you will not get any olive oil, because the olives will drop off the trees.

41.verse: You will have sons and daughters, but you will not be able to keep them, because they will be taken captive.

42.verse: Locusts will destroy all your trees and crops.

43.verse: The foreigners who live among you will get stronger and stronger, and you will get weaker and weaker.

44.verse: Foreigners will lend money to you, but you will not be able to lend to them. They will be like the head, and you will be like the tail.

45.verse: All these curses will come upon you. They will chase you and catch you and destroy you, because you did not obey the LORD your God and keep the commands and laws he gave you.

46.verse: The curses will be signs and miracles to you and your descendants forever.

47.verse: You had plenty of everything, but you did not serve the LORD your God with joy and a pure heart,

48.verse: so you will serve the enemies the LORD sends against you. You will be hungry, thirsty, naked, and poor, and the LORD will put a load on you until he has destroyed you.

49.verse: The Curse of an Enemy Nation - The LORD will bring a nation against you from far away, from the end of the world, and it will swoop down like an eagle. You won’t understand their language,

50.verse: and they will look mean. They will not respect old people or feel sorry for the young.

51.verse: They will eat the calves from your herds and the harvest of your field, and you will be destroyed. They will not leave you any grain, new wine or oil, or any calves from your herds or lambs from your flocks. You will be ruined.

52.verse: That nation will surround and attack all your cities. You trust in your high, strong walls, but they will fall down. That nation will surround all your cities everywhere in the land the LORD your God is giving you.

53.verse: Your enemy will surround you. Those people will make you starve so that you will eat your own babies, the bodies of the sons and daughters the LORD your God gave you.

54.verse: Even the most gentle and kind man among you will become cruel to his brother, his wife whom he loves, and his children who are still alive.

55.verse: He will not even give them any of the flesh of his children he is eating, because it will be all he has left. Your enemy will surround you and make you starve in all your cities.

56.verse: The most gentle and kind woman among you, so gentle and kind she would hardly even walk on the ground, will be cruel to her husband whom she loves and to her son and daughter.

57.verse: She will give birth to a baby, but she will plan to eat the baby and what comes after the birth itself. She will eat them secretly while the enemy surrounds the city. Those people will make you starve in all your cities.

58.verse: Be careful to obey everything in these teachings that are written in this book. You must respect the glorious and wonderful name of the LORD your God,

59.verse: or the LORD will give terrible diseases to you and your descendants. You will have long and serious diseases, and long and miserable sicknesses.

60.verse: He will give you all the diseases of Egypt that you dread, and the diseases will stay with you.

61.verse: The LORD will also give you every disease and sickness not written in this Book of the Teachings, until you are destroyed.

62.verse: You people may have outnumbered the stars, but only a few of you will be left, because you did not obey the LORD your God.

63.verse: Just as the LORD was once happy with you and gave you good things and made you grow in number, so then the LORD will be happy to ruin and destroy you, and you will be removed from the land you are entering to take as your own.

64.verse: Then the LORD will scatter you among the nations—from one end of the earth to the other. There you will serve other gods of wood and stone, gods that neither you nor your ancestors have known.

65.verse: You will have no rest among those nations and no place that is yours. The LORD will make your mind worried, your sight weak, and your soul sad.

66.verse: You will live with danger and be afraid night and day. You will not be sure that you will live.

67.verse: In the morning you will say, “I wish it were evening,” and in the evening you will say, “I wish it were morning.” Terror will be in your heart, and the things you have seen will scare you.

68.verse: The LORD will send you back to Egypt in ships, even though I, Moses, said you would never go back to Egypt. And there you will try to sell yourselves as slaves to your enemies, but no one will buy you.

1.verse: The Agreement in Moab - The LORD commanded Moses to make an agreement with the Israelites in Moab in addition to the agreement he had made with them at Mount Sinai. These are the words of that agreement.

2.verse: Moses called all the Israelites together and said to them: You have seen everything the LORD did before your own eyes to the king of Egypt and to the king’s leaders and to the whole country.

3.verse: With your own eyes you saw the great troubles, signs, and miracles.

4.verse: But to this day the LORD has not given you a mind that understands; you don’t really understand what you see with your eyes or hear with your ears.

5.verse: I led you through the desert for forty years, and during that time neither your clothes nor sandals wore out.

6.verse: You ate no bread and drank no wine or beer. This was so you would understand that I am the LORD your God.

7.verse: When you came to this place, Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out to fight us, but we defeated them.

8.verse: We captured their land and gave it to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and East Manasseh to be their own.

9.verse: You must carefully obey everything in this agreement so that you will succeed in everything you do.

10.verse: Today you are all standing here before the LORD your God—your leaders and important men, your elders, officers, and all the other men of Israel,

11.verse: your wives and children and the foreigners who live among you, who chop your wood and carry your water.

12.verse: You are all here to enter into an agreement and a promise with the LORD your God, an agreement the LORD your God is making with you today.

13.verse: This will make you today his own people. He will be your God, as he told you and as he promised your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

14.verse: But I am not just making this agreement and its promises with you

15.verse: who are standing here before the LORD your God today, but also with those who are not here today.

16.verse: You know how we lived in Egypt and how we passed through the countries when we came here.

17.verse: You saw their hateful idols made of wood, stone, silver, and gold.

18.verse: Make sure no man, woman, family group, or tribe among you leaves the LORD our God to go and serve the gods of those nations. They would be to you like a plant that grows bitter, poisonous fruit.

19.verse: These are the kind of people who hear these curses but bless themselves, thinking, “We will be safe even though we continue doing what we want to do.” Those people may destroy all of your land, both wet and dry.

20.verse: The LORD will not forgive them. His anger will be like a burning fire against those people, and all the curses written in this book will come on them. The LORD will destroy any memory of them on the earth.

21.verse: He will separate them from all the tribes of Israel for punishment. All the curses of the Agreement that are written in this Book of the Teachings will happen to them.

22.verse: Your children who will come after you, as well as foreigners from faraway lands, will see the disasters that come to this land and the diseases the LORD will send on it. They will say,

23.verse: “The land is nothing but burning cinders and salt. Nothing is planted, nothing grows, and nothing blooms. It is like Sodom and Gomorrah, and Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD destroyed because he was very angry.”

24.verse: All the other nations will ask, “Why has the LORD done this to the land? Why is he so angry?”

25.verse: And the answer will be, “It is because the people broke the Agreement of the LORD, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out of Egypt.

26.verse: They went and served other gods and bowed down to gods they did not even know. The LORD did not allow that,

27.verse: so he became very angry at the land and brought all the curses on it that are written in this book.

28.verse: Since the LORD became angry and furious with them, he took them out of their land and put them in another land where they are today.”

29.verse: There are some things the LORD our God has kept secret, but there are some things he has let us know. These things belong to us and our children forever so that we will do everything in these teachings.

1.verse: The Israelites Will Return - When all these blessings and curses I have described happen to you, and the LORD your God has sent you away to other nations, think about these things.

2.verse: Then you and your children will return to the LORD your God, and you will obey him with your whole being in everything I am commanding you today.

3.verse: Then the LORD your God will give you back your freedom. He will feel sorry for you, and he will bring you back again from the nations where he scattered you.

4.verse: He may send you to the ends of the earth, but he will gather you and bring you back from there,

5.verse: back to the land that belonged to your ancestors. It will be yours. He will give you success, and there will be more of you than there were of your ancestors.

6.verse: The LORD your God will prepare you and your descendants to love him with your whole being so that you will live.

7.verse: The LORD your God will put all these curses on your enemies, who hate you and are cruel to you.

8.verse: And you will again obey the LORD, keeping all his commands that I give you today.

9.verse: The LORD your God will make you successful in everything you do. You will have many children, your cattle will have many calves, and your fields will produce good crops, because the LORD will again be happy with you, just as he was with your ancestors.

10.verse: But you must obey the LORD your God by keeping all his commands and rules that are written in this Book of the Teachings. You must return to the LORD your God with your whole being.

11.verse: Choose Life or Death - This command I give you today is not too hard for you; it is not beyond what you can do.

12.verse: It is not up in heaven. You do not have to ask, “Who will go up to heaven and get it for us so we can obey it and keep it?”

13.verse: It is not on the other side of the sea. You do not have to ask, “Who will go across the sea and get it? Who will tell it to us so we can keep it?”

14.verse: No, the word is very near you. It is in your mouth and in your heart so you may obey it.

15.verse: Look, today I offer you life and success, death and destruction.

16.verse: I command you today to love the LORD your God, to do what he wants you to do, and to keep his commands, his rules, and his laws. Then you will live and grow in number, and the LORD your God will bless you in the land you are entering to take as your own.

17.verse: But if you turn away from the LORD and do not obey him, if you are led to bow and serve other gods,

18.verse: I tell you today that you will surely be destroyed. And you will not live long in the land you are crossing the Jordan River to enter and take as your own.

19.verse: Today I ask heaven and earth to be witnesses. I am offering you life or death, blessings or curses. Now, choose life! Then you and your children may live.

20.verse: To choose life is to love the LORD your God, obey him, and stay close to him. He is your life, and he will let you live many years in the land, the land he promised to give your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

1.verse: Joshua Takes Moses’ Place - Then Moses went and spoke these words to all the Israelites:

2.verse: “I am now one hundred twenty years old, and I cannot lead you anymore. The LORD told me I would not cross the Jordan River;

3.verse: the LORD your God will lead you across himself. He will destroy those nations for you, and you will take over their land. Joshua will also lead you across, as the LORD has said.

4.verse: The LORD will do to those nations what he did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, when he destroyed them and their land.

5.verse: The LORD will give those nations to you; do to them everything I told you.

6.verse: Be strong and brave. Don’t be afraid of them and don’t be frightened, because the LORD your God will go with you. He will not leave you or forget you.”

7.verse: Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in front of the people, “Be strong and brave, because you will lead these people into the land the LORD promised to give their ancestors, and help them take it as their own.

8.verse: The LORD himself will go before you. He will be with you; he will not leave you or forget you. Don’t be afraid and don’t worry.”

9.verse: Moses Writes the Teachings - So Moses wrote down these teachings and gave them to the priests and all the elders of Israel. (The priests are the sons of Levi, who carry the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD.)

10.verse: Then Moses commanded them: “Read these teachings for all Israel to hear at the end of every seven years, which is the year to cancel what people owe. Do it during the Feast of Shelters, when all the Israelites will come to appear before the LORD your God and stand at the place he will choose.

11.verse: Then Moses commanded them: “Read these teachings for all Israel to hear at the end of every seven years, which is the year to cancel what people owe. Do it during the Feast of Shelters, when all the Israelites will come to appear before the LORD your God and stand at the place he will choose.

12.verse: Gather all the people: the men, women, children, and foreigners living in your towns so that they can listen and learn to respect the LORD your God and carefully obey everything in this law.

13.verse: Since their children do not know this law, they must hear it. They must learn to respect the LORD your God for as long as they live in the land you are crossing the Jordan River to take for your own.”

14.verse: The Lord Calls Moses and Joshua - The LORD said to Moses, “Soon you will die. Get Joshua and come to the Meeting Tent so that I may command him.” So Moses and Joshua went to the Meeting Tent.

15.verse: The LORD appeared at the Meeting Tent in a cloud; the cloud stood over the entrance of the Tent.

16.verse: And the LORD said to Moses, “You will soon die. Then these people will not be loyal to me but will worship the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will leave me, breaking the Agreement I made with them.

17.verse: Then I will become very angry at them, and I will leave them. I will turn away from them, and they will be destroyed. Many terrible things will happen to them. Then they will say, ‘It is because God is not with us that these terrible things are happening.’

18.verse: I will surely turn away from them then, because they have done wrong and have turned to other gods.

19.verse: “Now write down this song and teach it to the Israelites. Then have them sing it, because it will be my witness against them.

20.verse: When I bring them into the land I promised to their ancestors, a fertile land, they will eat as much as they want and get fat. Then they will turn to other gods and serve them. They will reject me and break my Agreement.

21.verse: Then when many troubles and terrible things happen to them, this song will testify against them, because the song will not be forgotten by their descendants. I know what they plan to do, even before I take them into the land I promised them.”

22.verse: So Moses wrote down the song that day, and he taught it to the Israelites.

23.verse: Then the LORD gave this command to Joshua son of Nun: “Be strong and brave, because you will lead the people of Israel to the land I promised them, and I will be with you.”

24.verse: After Moses finished writing all the words of the teachings in a book,

25.verse: he gave a command to the Levites, who carried the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD.

26.verse: He said, “Take this Book of the Teachings and put it beside the Ark of the Agreement with the LORD your God. It must stay there as a witness against you.

27.verse: I know how stubborn and disobedient you are. You have disobeyed the LORD while I am alive and with you, and you will disobey even more after I die!

28.verse: Gather all the elders of your tribes and all your officers to me so that I may say these things for them to hear, and so that I may ask heaven and earth to testify against them.

29.verse: I know that after I die you will become completely evil. You will turn away from the commands I have given you. Terrible things will happen to you in the future when you do what the LORD says is evil, and you will make him angry with the idols you have made.”

30.verse: Moses’ Song - And Moses spoke this whole song for all the people of Israel to hear:

1.verse: Hear, heavens, and I will speak. Listen, earth, to what I say.

2.verse: My teaching will drop like rain; my words will fall like dew. They will be like showers on the grass; they will pour down like rain on young plants.

3.verse: I will announce the name of the LORD. Praise God because he is great!

4.verse: He is like a rock; what he does is perfect, and he is always fair. He is a faithful God who does no wrong, who is right and fair.

5.verse: They have done evil against him. To their shame they are no longer his children; they are an evil and lying people.

6.verse: This is not the way to repay the LORD, you foolish and unwise people. He is your Father and Maker, who made you and formed you.

7.verse: Remember the old days. Think of the years already passed. Ask your father and he will tell you; ask your elders and they will inform you.

8.verse: God Most High gave the nations their lands, dividing up the human race. He set up borders for the people and even numbered the Israelites.

9.verse: The LORD took his people as his share, the people of Jacob as his very own.

10.verse: He found them in a desert, a windy, empty land. He surrounded them and brought them up, guarding them as those he loved very much.

11.verse: He was like an eagle building its nest that flutters over its young. It spreads its wings to catch them and carries them on its feathers.

12.verse: The LORD alone led them, and there was no foreign god helping him.

13.verse: The LORD brought them to the heights of the land and fed them the fruit of the fields. He gave them honey from the rocks, bringing oil from the solid rock.

14.verse: There were milk curds from the cows and milk from the flock; there were fat sheep and goats. There were sheep and goats from Bashan and the best of the wheat. You drank the juice of grapes.

15.verse: Israel grew fat and kicked; they were fat and full and firm. They left the God who made them and rejected the Rock who saved them.

16.verse: They made God jealous with foreign gods and angry with hateful idols.

17.verse: They made sacrifices to demons, not God, to gods they had never known, new gods from nearby, gods your ancestors did not fear.

18.verse: You left God who is the Rock, your Father, and you forgot the God who gave you birth.

19.verse: The LORD saw this and rejected them; his sons and daughters had made him angry.

20.verse: He said, “I will turn away from them and see what will happen to them. They are evil people, unfaithful children.

21.verse: They used things that are not gods to make me jealous and worthless idols to make me angry. So I will use those who are not a nation to make them jealous; I will use a nation that does not understand to make them angry.

22.verse: My anger has started a fire that burns down to the place of the dead. It will burn up the ground and its crops, and it will set fire to the base of the mountains.

23.verse: “I will pile troubles upon them and shoot my arrows at them.

24.verse: They will be starved and sick, destroyed by terrible diseases. I will send them vicious animals and gliding, poisonous snakes.

25.verse: In the streets the sword will kill; in their homes there will be terror. Young men and women will die, and so will babies and gray-haired men.

26.verse: I will scatter them as I said, and no one will remember them.

27.verse: But I didn’t want their enemy to brag; their enemy might misunderstand and say, ‘We have won! The LORD has done none of this.’”

28.verse: Israel has no sense; they do not understand.

29.verse: I wish they were wise and understood this; I wish they could see what will happen to them.

30.verse: One person cannot chase a thousand people, and two people cannot fight ten thousand unless their Rock has sold them, unless the LORD has given them up.

31.verse: The rock of these people is not like our Rock; our enemies agree to that.

32.verse: Their vine comes from Sodom, and their fields are like Gomorrah. Their grapes are full of poison; their bunches of grapes are bitter.

33.verse: Their wine is like snake poison, like the deadly poison of cobras.

34.verse: “I have been saving this, and I have it locked in my storehouses.

35.verse: I will punish those who do wrong; I will repay them. Soon their foot will slip, because their day of trouble is near, and their punishment will come quickly.”

36.verse: The LORD will defend his people and have mercy on his servants. He will see that their strength is gone, that nobody is left, slaves or free.

37.verse: Then he will say, “Where are their gods? Where is the rock they trusted?

38.verse: Who ate the fat from their sacrifices, and who drank the wine of their drink offerings? Let those gods come to help you! Let them protect you!

39.verse: “Now you will see that I am the one God! There is no god but me. I send life and death; I can hurt, and I can heal. No one can escape from me.

40.verse: I raise my hand toward heaven and make this promise: As surely as I live forever,

41.verse: I will sharpen my flashing sword, and I will take it in my hand to judge. I will punish my enemies and pay back those who hate me.

42.verse: My arrows will be covered with their blood; my sword will eat their flesh. The blood will flow from those who are killed and the captives. The heads of the enemy leaders will be cut off.”

43.verse: Be happy, nations, with his people, because he will repay you for the blood of his servants. He will punish his enemies, and he will remove the sin of his land and people.

44.verse: Moses came with Joshua son of Nun, and they spoke all the words of this song for the people to hear.

45.verse: When Moses finished speaking these words to all Israel,

46.verse: he said to them: “Pay careful attention to all the words I have said to you today, and command your children to obey carefully everything in these teachings.

47.verse: These should not be unimportant words for you, but rather they mean life for you! By these words you will live a long time in the land you are crossing the Jordan River to take as your own.”

48.verse: Moses Goes Up to Mount Nebo - The LORD spoke to Moses again that same day and said,

49.verse: “Go up the Abarim Mountains, to Mount Nebo in the country of Moab, across from Jericho. Look at the land of Canaan that I am giving to the Israelites as their own.

50.verse: On that mountain that you climb, you will die and join your ancestors, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and joined his ancestors.

51.verse: You both sinned against me at the waters of Meribah Kadesh in the Desert of Zin, and you did not honor me as holy there among the Israelites.

52.verse: So now you will only look at the land from far away. You will not enter the land I am giving the people of Israel.”

1.verse: Moses Blesses the People - Moses, the man of God, gave this blessing to the Israelites before he died.

2.verse: He said: “The LORD came from Mount Sinai and rose like the sun from Edom; he showed his greatness from Mount Paran. He came with thousands of angels from the southern mountains.

3.verse: The LORD surely loves his people and takes care of all those who belong to him. They bow down at his feet, and they are taught by him.

4.verse: Moses gave us the teachings that belong to the people of Jacob.

5.verse: The LORD became king of Israel when the leaders of the people gathered, when the tribes of Israel came together.

6.verse: “Let the people of Reuben live and not die, but let the people be few.”

7.verse: Moses said this about the people of Judah: “LORD, listen to Judah’s prayer; bring them back to their people. They defend themselves with their hands. Help them fight their enemies!”

8.verse: Moses said this about the people of Levi: “LORD, your Thummim and Urim belong to Levi, whom you love. LORD, you tested him at Massah and argued with him at the waters of Meribah.

9.verse: He said about his father and mother, ‘I don’t care about them.’ He did not treat his brothers as favorites or give special favors to his children, but he protected your word and guarded your agreement.

10.verse: He teaches your laws to the people of Jacob and your teachings to the people of Israel. He burns incense before you and makes whole burnt offerings on your altar.

11.verse: LORD, make them strong; be pleased with the work they do. Defeat those who attack them, and don’t let their enemies rise up again.”

12.verse: Moses said this about the people of Benjamin: “The LORD’s loved ones will lie down in safety, because he protects them all day long. The ones he loves rest with him.”

13.verse: Moses said this about the people of Joseph: “May the LORD bless their land with wonderful dew from heaven, with water from the springs below,

14.verse: with the best fruits that the sun brings, and with the best fruits that the moon brings.

15.verse: Let the old mountains give the finest crops, and let the everlasting hills give the best fruits.

16.verse: Let the full earth give the best fruits, and let the LORD who lived in the burning bush be pleased. May these blessings rest on the head of Joseph, on the forehead of the one who was blessed among his brothers.

17.verse: Joseph has the majesty of a firstborn bull; he is as strong as a wild ox. He will stab other nations, even those nations far away. These are the ten thousands of Ephraim, and these are the thousands of Manasseh.”

18.verse: Moses said this about the people of Zebulun: “Be happy when you go out, Zebulun, and be happy in your tents, Issachar.

19.verse: They will call the people to the mountain, and there they will offer the right sacrifices. They will do well from all that is in the sea, and they will do well from the treasures hidden in the sand on the shore.”

20.verse: Moses said this about the people of Gad: “Praise God who gives Gad more land! Gad lives there like a lion, who tears off arms and heads.

21.verse: They chose the best land for themselves. They received a large share, like that given to an officer. When the leaders of the people gathered, the people of Gad did what the LORD said was right, and they judged Israel fairly.”

22.verse: Moses said this about the people of Dan: “Dan is like a lion’s cub, who jumps out of Bashan.”

23.verse: Moses said this about the people of Naphtali: “Naphtali enjoys special kindnesses, and they are full of the LORD’s blessings. Take as your own the west and south.”

24.verse: Moses said this about the people of Asher: “Asher is the most blessed of the sons; let him be his brothers’ favorite. Let him bathe his feet in olive oil.

25.verse: Your gates will have locks of iron and bronze, and you will be strong as long as you live.

26.verse: “There is no one like the God of Israel, who rides through the skies to help you, who rides on the clouds in his majesty.

27.verse: The everlasting God is your place of safety, and his arms will hold you up forever. He will force your enemy out ahead of you, saying, ‘Destroy the enemy!’

28.verse: The people of Israel will lie down in safety. Jacob’s spring is theirs alone. Theirs is a land full of grain and new wine, where the skies drop their dew.

29.verse: Israel, you are blessed! No one else is like you, because you are a people saved by the LORD. He is your shield and helper, your glorious sword. Your enemies will be afraid of you, and you will walk all over their holy places.”

1.verse: Moses Dies - Then Moses climbed Mount Nebo from the plains of Moab to the top of Mount Pisgah, across from Jericho. From there the LORD showed him all the land from Gilead to Dan,

2.verse: all of Naphtali and the lands of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Mediterranean Sea,

3.verse: as well as the southern desert and the whole Valley of Jericho up to Zoar. (Jericho is called the city of palm trees.)

4.verse: Then the LORD said to Moses, “This is the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said to them, ‘I will give this land to your descendants.’ I have let you look at it, Moses, but you will not cross over there.”

5.verse: Then Moses, the servant of the LORD, died there in Moab, as the LORD had said.

6.verse: He buried Moses in Moab in the valley opposite Beth Peor, but even today no one knows where his grave is.

7.verse: Moses was one hundred twenty years old when he died. His eyes were not weak, and he was still strong.

8.verse: The Israelites cried for Moses for thirty days, staying in the plains of Moab until the time of sadness was over.

9.verse: Joshua son of Nun was then filled with wisdom, because Moses had put his hands on him. So the Israelites listened to Joshua, and they did what the LORD had commanded Moses.

10.verse: There has never been another prophet in Israel like Moses. The LORD knew Moses face to face

11.verse: and sent him to do signs and miracles in Egypt—to the king, to all his officers, and to the whole land of Egypt.

12.verse: Moses had great power, and he did great and wonderful things for all the Israelites to see.
